page.title: 18THE M1 MOTORWAY
page.content: The{M1 motorway,}a major part of the motorway system of England passes through our area to the north east of the village of{Selston.}The M1 was the first motorway to be built in England. It links the cities of London and Leeds. The M1 has 3 lanes for traffic travelling in either direction. Only certain types of vehicle are allowed to use it. Pedestrians, bicycles, horses, small motor cycles and learner drivers are prohibited. The M1 is important to our area because it allows people and goods to travel quickly to the north or to the south of the country. When the motorway was first built some people complained because valuable farmland had to be utilised and people also thought that it would be noisy and dangerous.
